Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk python-configshell
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: python-configshell bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The python-configshell package provides a library for implementing configuration command line interfaces for the Python programming environment. The python-configshell package has been upgraded to upstream version 1.1.fb14, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. Specifically, this rebase includes the following bug fixes: Previously, executing the "targetcli [cmd]" command always returned a success status code, which made writing shell scripts that handled errors very difficult. Now, if an error occurs in "targetcli [cmd]", a nonzero status code is returned. Prior to this update, running "help" by itself without a command caused an exception, which could confuse the user. This has been fixed, and the exception is now handled as expected. (BZ#1151189) This update also fixes the following bug: Previously, some targetcli commands generated a traceback error when the grep command was executed on them, which prevented the user from investigating the grep output. A patch has been provided to fix this bug, and the "targetcli grep" command now works as intended. (BZ#1061157) Users of python-configshell are advised to upgrade to this updated package, which fixes these bugs and adds these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
